review: I purchased my Roku 3500R Streaming Stick at a local retailer - intended for use to watch Netflix and NBA League Pass.  The Streaming Stick worked flawlessly for 28 days and thereafter will not see any WiFi signals at all.  Took it back to the store and got a replacement and the remote control of the replacement unit failed in exactly one month.  Contacted Roku online support and received a replacement remote control by mail.  Then a little over a month later, the Roku Streaming Stick - even though it's connected to my WiFi signal - will not connect to any of the streaming servers.  I'm quivering in my sandals at what could possibly happen next...This thing is just a WiFi adapter with a bit of flash memory/ROM to hold your sign-on information and a simple Roku program, so it's only like ... slightly more sophisticated than a lightbulb or mashed potatoes, okay?  How can one F up something this simple is beyond me.I hope y'all have better luck than me.  As for all the troubles I'm suffering thru, I'll say:  "Inshallah!"
